alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 5:58PM EDT until August 10 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Letcher and Pike. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Jenkins, Garden Village, Shelbiana, Chloe, Raccoon, Virgie, Zebulon, Jonancy, Dorton, Myra, Kimper, Meta, Beefhide, Adamson, Burdine, Gaskill, Dunham, McRoberts and Payne Gap. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
